title: 'Nothing wrong with ambition'
text:
Romelu Lukaku insists 'there is nothing wrong with ambition' as Everton future remains uncertain By Lyall Thomas  47pm Romelu Lukaku is in talks over a new contract at Everton but has not yet signed Romelu Lukaku insists there is "nothing wrong" with speaking about his ambitions to play Champions League football and win trophies, and believes he has at times been taken out of context. 
The Belgium striker - currently preparing for a World Cup Qualifier against Greece on Saturday - has been in protracted talks over a new Everton contract, but Sky Sports News HQ understands he as agreed terms on a new five-year deal . 
The club have been desperate to pin him down, with his current contract to expire in 2018, and a string of top clubs in Europe interested in his signing. Lukaku has become Belgium's first-choice striker 
Former Everton boss and current Belgium head coach Roberto Martinez said this week that Lukaku could become the best number nine in the world, and asked if the agreed with his manager, Lukaku said: "Yes. 
"There is nothing wrong with ambition. You have to embrace it and where you are as a footballer. 
"I've made a long way until now but the road is still long and I know I have to improve and get better. I want to help Everton as much as I can, as well as the national team. I think a lot of stuff can be achieved. 
"Sometimes people will mistake things that I say but it's just ambition that I have; I want to win titles and trophies and I don't think people should take that as arrogance - people should embrace it. 
"This is what footballers need to achieve if they want to be the best. And I think young kids need to learn that too."
